cyclone.name: MARIA
cyclone.current_location: about 210 miles ESE of Dominica (and 100 miles NE of Barbados)
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking west-northwest across the Leeward Islands and projected to pass near the U.S. and British Virgin Islands and Puerto Rico mid-week

weather_observation.watch_coast: U.S. Virgin Islands, British Virgin Islands, Saba & St. Eustatius, St. Maarten/Martin, Anguilla
weather_observation.warning_coast: Guadeloupe, Dominica, St. Kitts–Nevis–Montserrat, Martinique (Hurricane); Antigua & Barbuda, Saba & St. Eustatius, St. Lucia (Tropical Storm)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Leeward Islands, U.S. & British Virgin Islands, Puerto Rico, northeastern Caribbean
weather_observation.wind: Hurricane-force winds possible Tuesday night through Wednesday; sustained winds could exceed 85–100 mph with higher gusts.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential surge 3–6 ft above normal tides, accompanied by large destructive waves on south- and east-facing shores of St. Croix.
weather_observation.rainfall: 6–12 inches with locally up to 20 inches; life-threatening flash flooding and mudslides possible.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents beginning Monday night.
